results.title:
Radio Rythm, No. A9-1-2A
Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Radio romance
results.brief_description: Radio romance is an endearing work which creates warmth through the subtle use of multiple narratives and the affable assured performance of the band. Camera work and editing confidently exploit the rich setting with the songline expertly supported by the light-hearted use of props. Music performed by Strange Country.

results.title: Radio Dog
results.brief_description: In Albion, an anarchist republic of the near future, Felix is listening to Radio Dog as he shaves off his beard. His daydreams gradually form a kaleidoscope portrait of the mongrel city, where doctors serve liquid sunshine on the concrete beach and savage diesel rhythms shake the massive Gun Fetish Club.

results.title: Radio days
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: I love old radio stories, and I know a million of them. I’ve collected them down through the years like a hobby. Anecdotes, gossip and inside stories about the stars. Plus I recall so many personal experiences, from when I grew up, listening to show after show. Now it’s all gone, except for the memories. Let Woody Allen take you back to the golden era of the radio days. Linking a number of colourful radio stories with a delightful look at his own childhood, the writer-director recreates a lost era. Discover the Masked Avengers horrible secret! See how a beautiful blonde cigarette girl goes on to find stardom! And how some burglars win the star prize on radio “Guess that tune” for their unsuspecting victims!! Allen’s ensemble of actors includes Mia Farrow, Diane Keaton, Julie Kavner and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Radio day
results.brief_description: A promotional exercise that shows a day in the life of radio station 3XY in Melbourne. Although most of the activities carried out in a commercial radio station are depicted, there is no attempt to explain why and as such this production does little to demystify the process. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Radio broadcasting today
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Appraises all types of radio programs such as Jack Benny, Toscanini, sport, news etc. The value of quiz programs and soap operas is questioned and other types of programs are commended. Hooper ratings are explained and Lee DeForest appears briefly in the film to decry the misuse of the medium which he helped develop.

results.title: Radio astronomy in Australia
results.brief_description: The study of radio waves which celestial bodies emit and what these waves tell of the size, composition, temperature and other characteristics of these bodies. Deals with Australia’s contribution in the field and indicates the equipment involved, including the construction of a giant radio telescope.

results.title: Radio and television technician
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Work of the skilled radio and television technician includes the manufacture of radio and television receivers, the operation and maintenance of broadcasting equipment and telecommunications services. This is a field which is constantly expanding, and those who gain additional qualifications can progress to computer engineering, radio frequency heating and satellite communications.

results.title: Radiation
results.brief_description: From a sun-drenched bathing beach to an awesome “gamma garden,” this film explores how heat, radio waves, x-rays and gamma rays affect various forms of life. It takes you to the radiological department of a modern hospital, to Canada’s atomic research center at Chalk River, and to the Brookhaven National Laboratory in the United States, where plant growth is subjected to gamma radiation.

results.title: Radiant energy and the electromagnetic spectrum
results.brief_description: Re-enacted experiments of discovery and modern sensing devices introduce us to the various forms of radiant energy, giving insights into concepts of waves, wave-lengths and energy.
